meanings.definition: A person or thing that repulses or causes disgust.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the repulsers made me feel sick.
meanings.sent2: The repulsers in the horror movie were truly terrifying.
meanings.sent3: The repulsers at the party were the reason I left early.
meanings.sent4: Her attitude was like a repulsers, driving people away.
meanings.sent5: The repulsers in the haunted house were so realistic, they made me jump.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that repels or pushes away something.
meanings.sent1: The repulsers on the spaceship kept the aliens at bay.
meanings.sent2: The repulsers on the door prevented anyone from entering.
meanings.sent3: The repulsers on the vacuum cleaner were surprisingly effective.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as repulsers, pushing her further away.
meanings.sent5: The repulsers on the electric fence kept the animals away from the garden.

meanings.definition: A force or action that repels or drives back.
meanings.sent1: The repulsers of the magnet pushed the two ends apart.
meanings.sent2: The repulsers of the wind made it difficult to walk forward.
meanings.sent3: The repulsers of the water fountain sprayed in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The repulsers of her personality made it hard to approach her.
meanings.sent5: The repulsers of the repellent spray kept the bugs away from the picnic.
